page.title: 07Farming-2
page.content: the fields. In late March they turn the cows out. In late May they make silage and shear the sheep. In June they make hay and dip the sheep. In August the straw is bailed. In September fences are replaced and hedges are trimmed. In November if it's wet they bring the cows in,but otherwise the cows stay outside until December. The Bamfield's farmhouse was built in the 1970's as a replacement for the original house, the courthouse, which was built in the {16th }century and burnt down in later years. The farm has 110 acres off land, and in 1870 was worth Â£4,750. But in 1829 it had doubled it's price and was worth Â£10,500. In 1949 Mr and Mrs Harding moved in as
